criteria.title: Does each informative image have a text alternative?
Is each decorative image correctly ignored by assistive technologies?
For each informative image with a text alternative, is the alternative relevant (except special cases)?
For each image used as a CAPTCHA or test image with a text alternative, does the alternative identify the nature and function of the image?
For each CAPTCHA image, is an alternative way to access the content or function of the CAPTCHA provided?
Does each informative image have, when necessary, a detailed description?
For each informative image with a detailed description, is the description relevant?
For each informative text image, in the absence of a replacement mechanism, is it replaced where possible with styled text (except special cases)?
Is each image caption, when necessary, correctly associated with the corresponding image?
Does each frame have a frame title?
For each frame with a frame title, is the title relevant?
On each web page, is information not conveyed by color alone?
On each web page, is the contrast between text color and background color sufficiently high (except special cases)?
On each web page, are the colors used in UI components or informative graphical elements sufficiently contrasted (except special cases)?
Does each pre-recorded time-based media have, when necessary, a text transcript or audio description (except special cases)?
For each pre-recorded time-based media with a text transcript or synchronized audio description, are they relevant (except special cases)?
Does each pre-recorded synchronized time-based media have, when necessary, synchronized captions/subtitles (except special cases)?
For each pre-recorded synchronized time-based media with synchronized captions/subtitles, are the captions relevant?
Does each pre-recorded time-based media have, when necessary, a synchronized audio description (except special cases)?
For each pre-recorded time-based media with a synchronized audio description, is it relevant?
Is each time-based media clearly identifiable (except special cases)?
Does each non time-based media have, when necessary, an alternative (except special cases)?
For each non time-based media with an alternative, is the alternative relevant?
Can each sound that starts automatically be controlled by the user?
Can each time-based media be controlled, when necessary, by keyboard and any pointing device?
Can each non time-based media be controlled by keyboard and any pointing device?
Is each time-based and non time-based media compatible with assistive technologies (except special cases)?
Does each complex data table have a summary?
For each complex data table with a summary, is it relevant?
For each layout table, does the linearized content remain understandable?
For each data table with a title, is the title correctly associated with the data table?
For each data table with a title, is the title relevant?
For each data table, are each column header and each row header correctly declared?
For each data table, is an appropriate technique used to associate each cell with its headers (except special cases)?
Does each layout table avoid using elements specific to data tables?
Is each link explicit (except special cases)?
On each web page, does each link have a label/text?
Is each script, when necessary, compatible with assistive technologies?
For each script with an alternative, is the alternative relevant?
Can each script be controlled by keyboard and any pointing device (except special cases)?
For each script that initiates a change of context, is the user warned or in control?
On each web page, are status messages correctly conveyed by assistive technologies?
Is each web page defined by a document type?
For each web page, is the generated source code valid according to the specified document type?
On each web page, is the default language present?
For each web page with a default language, is the language code valid and relevant?
Does each web page have a page title?
For each web page with a page title, is the title relevant?
On each web page, is each language change indicated in the source code (except special cases)?
On each web page, is the language code for each language change valid and relevant?
On each web page, are tags not used for presentation purposes only?
On each web page, are changes in reading direction indicated?
On each web page, is information structured through appropriate use of headings?
On each web page, is the document structure consistent (except special cases)?
On each web page, is each list correctly structured?
On each web page, is each quotation correctly indicated?
On the website, are style sheets used to control the presentation of information?
On each web page, does visible informative content remain present when style sheets are disabled?
On each web page, does information remain understandable when style sheets are disabled?
On each web page, does text remain readable when the font size is increased to at least 200% (except special cases)?
On each web page, are CSS declarations for background colors and font colors used correctly?
On each web page, is each link whose nature is not obvious visually distinguishable from surrounding text?
On each web page, for each element receiving focus, is the focus visible?
For each web page, are hidden contents intended to be ignored by assistive technologies?
On each web page, is information not conveyed by shape, size, or position alone?
On each web page, is the rule 'information must not be conveyed by shape, size, or position alone' implemented in a relevant way?

For each web page, can content be presented without loss of information or functionality and without requiring vertical scrolling at 256px height or horizontal scrolling at 320px width (except special cases)?
On each web page, can text spacing properties be overridden by the user without loss of content or functionality (except special cases)?
On each web page, are additional contents that appear on focus or hover of a UI component controllable by the user (except special cases)?
On each web page, can additional contents that appear only via CSS styles be made visible by keyboard and any pointing device?
Does each form field have a label?
For each label associated with a form field, is the label relevant (except special cases)?
Within each form, are repeated labels for fields with the same function consistent across the page or set of pages?
Within each form, are each field label and its associated field adjacent (except special cases)?
Within each form, are fields of the same nature grouped when necessary?
Within each form, does each group of fields of the same nature have a legend?
For each legend associated with a group of fields of the same nature, is it relevant?
Within each form, are items of the same nature within a choice list grouped in a relevant way?
Within each form, is the label of each button relevant (except special cases)?
Within each form, is input validation used in a relevant way (except special cases)?
Within each form, is input validation accompanied, when necessary, by suggestions to help correct input errors?

For each form that modifies or deletes data, submits answers to a test/exam, or whose validation has financial or legal consequences, can the entered data be modified, updated, or retrieved by the user?
Can the purpose of an input field be inferred to facilitate autofill with the user's data?
Does each set of pages provide at least two different navigation systems (except special cases)?
Within each set of pages, are menus and navigation bars always in the same place (except special cases)?
Is the 'site map' page relevant?
Within each set of pages, is the 'site map' page accessible via an identical feature/mechanism?
Within each set of pages, is the search engine reachable in an identical manner?
Can content grouping areas present across multiple web pages (header, main navigation, main content, footer, and search) be reached or skipped?
On each web page, is a skip link or quick access link to the main content area present (except special cases)?
On each web page, is the tab order consistent?
On each web page, does navigation avoid keyboard traps?
On each web page, can single-key keyboard shortcuts (lowercase/uppercase letter, punctuation, digit or symbol) be controlled by the user?
On each web page, are additional contents appearing on hover, focus, or activation of a UI component reachable by keyboard when necessary?
For each web page, does the user have control over each time limit that modifies content (except special cases)?
On each web page, is opening a new window not triggered without user action?
On each web page, does each downloadable office document have, when necessary, an accessible version (except special cases)?
For each office document with an accessible version, does that version provide the same information?
On each web page, does each cryptic content (ASCII art, emoticon, cryptic syntax) have an alternative?
On each web page, for each cryptic content with an alternative, is the alternative relevant?
On each web page, are sudden brightness changes or flash effects used correctly?
On each web page, can each moving or blinking content be controlled by the user?
On each web page, is content usable regardless of screen orientation (portrait or landscape) (except special cases)?
On each web page, can features that require a complex gesture also be available via a simple gesture (except special cases)?
On each web page, can actions triggered via a pointing device on a single point of the screen be cancelled (except special cases)?
On each web page, can features that involve moving the device or moving toward the device be satisfied in an alternative way (except special cases)?
